description: Smallest number of triangular numbers which sum to n.
comments: a(n)=3 if n=5 or 8 mod 9, since triangular numbers are {0,1,3,6} mod 9.
links: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: a(3)=1 since 3=3, a(4)=2 since 4=1+3, a(5)=3 since 5=1+1+3, with 1 and 3 being triangular.
mathematica: t[n_]:=n*(n+1)/2; a[0]=0; a[n_]:=Block[ {k=1, tt= t/@ Range[Sqrt[2*n]]}, Off[IntegerPartitions::take]; While[{} == IntegerPartitions[n, {k}, tt, 1], k++]; k]; a/@ Range[0, 104] (* _Giovanni Resta_, Jun 09 2015 *)
crossrefs: 0 if n=0, otherwise 1 if n is in A000217, otherwise 2 if n is in A051533, otherwise 3 in which case n is in A020757. Cf. A000217, A007294, A057945, A061337.
